title: US woman on child abuse charges dressed up as witch to terrorise granddaughter
text:
US woman on child abuse charges dressed up as witch to terrorise granddaughter Last updated 10:35, February 6 2017 
A US woman accused of child abuse has pleaded guilty to terrorising her granddaughter by dressing up as a witch and forcing the girl to sleep in a dog's kennel, among other methods. 
Oklahoma woman Geneva Robinson, 51, pleaded guilty to the charges on Thursday, local media reported. 
Robinson meted out severe acts of punishment on her seven-year-old granddaughter, including threatening her in a witch's costume, hanging her from a garage door and burning her with lit cigarettes. OCPD 
Geneva Robinson, 52, dressed up as a witch named Nelda to scare her granddaughter. 
The girl was also forced to sleep outside with the dogs on several occasions, according to a police report. READ MORE: 
Police suspect at least one other grandchild in the household to have also been abused. 
Robinson was believed to have used scissors to cut her grandson's fingers, WWLP reported. 
Community members were stunned over the bizarre acts of terror on Robinson's own grandchildren. 
"If it wasn't so serious, it would be laughable," said one neighbour. 
The abuse came to light after Robinson brought the girl to hospital in 2014. Ad Feedback 
The child was malnourished, badly bruised and cut, scarred with whip marks, and had infected ankles, local media News9 reported. 
She told hospital staff her grandmother would put on a green mask with red eyes to dress up as a witch named "Nelda", and would "take a pink dog leash and hang her in the middle of the garage underneath her arms". 
Nelda would use a "wand knife" and put it to her neck, she said. 
The girl also said Robinson threatened the "creatures in the attic were going to get her". 
Police officers who showed up at the house to investigate found evidence which corroborated the child's accounts, News9 reported. 
They found dog leashes attached to the garage door railings on the ceiling, a witch's costume and a dagger prop. 
Robinson is due to be sentenced on March 28. - Stuff
